item.title: All Thyrocare labs are now NABL accredited - Medical Buyer
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Ex-Supreme Court judge V Ramasubramanian appointed NHRC chief - The Times of India
item.description:
V Ramasubramanian appointed as new NHRC chief

Publication Date: December 18, 2023 Source: Times of India

The former Supreme Court judge, V Ramasubramanian, has been appointed as the ninth chairperson of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) of India. This position had been vacant since June 2023.

  • V Ramasubramanian served as a Supreme Court judge from 2019 to 2023.
  • He was previously the Chief Justice of Himachal Pradesh high court.
  • He became the first judge to hold a hearing over Skype.
  • He advocated for the decriminalization of defamation and supported freedom of expression.
  • His appointment follows a high-powered committee meeting led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
"This is untrue. Presently, I am enjoying my retired life." - DY Chandrachud, former Chief Justice of India.

The appointment of V Ramasubramanian as NHRC chief highlights a significant transition in India's human rights protection landscape following a vacancy of several months.

item.title: WhatsApp may stop working on these Android smartphones starting next week - The Times of India
item.description:
WhatsApp may stop working on these Android smartphones starting next week

Publication Date: January 1, 2025, Source: Times of India

WhatsApp is set to discontinue support for Android devices running on KitKat or older versions starting January 1, 2025, as part of a move by Meta to ensure app security and functionality.

  • The change affects several older smartphones from brands like Samsung, Motorola, HTC, LG, and Sony.
  • Key outdated models include Galaxy S3, Galaxy Note 2, Moto G (1st Gen), and iPhone models such as iPhone 5s.
  • Meta has a history of discontinuing support for older operating systems to maintain compatibility and security standards.
  • Users are advised to upgrade to newer Android versions to continue accessing WhatsApp.
“This update will mainly affect users of older iPhones, specifically the iPhone 5s, iPhone 6, and iPhone 6 Plus, which are limited to iOS 12.5.7.”

In summary, this move emphasizes the necessity for users to stay updated with their devices to ensure continuous access to WhatsApp services.

item.title: Shami ruled out of remaining two Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Mohammed Shami Ruled Out of Remaining Two Tests in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Indian cricketer Mohammed Shami has been ruled out of the fourth and fifth Tests in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy due to swelling in his left knee, as per a BCCI press release.

  • Shami recently played for Bengal and had a busy schedule leading up to the Tests.
  • His knee swelling is attributed to increased workload from recent bowling activities.
  • The BCCI medical team recommends more time for recovery before he can return to play.
“The swelling is on the expected lines, owing to the increased bowling after a prolonged period.”

Shami has been recovering from a heel injury and will continue strength and conditioning work. His participation in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy will depend on his knee condition.

item.title: Jaishankar to begin 6-day visit to US from December 24 - The Times of India
item.description:
Jaishankar to Begin 6-Day Visit to US from December 24

Date: December 24-29, 2023

Source: Times of India

External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is set to embark on a significant six-day official visit to the United States starting from December 24, marking a key diplomatic engagement post the US presidential elections.

  • Jaishankar will focus on discussing crucial bilateral, regional, and global issues.
  • He will preside over a conference with India's Consul Generals in the US.
  • This visit follows Jaishankar's earlier trip to the US in September.
S Jaishankar is the first high-ranking Indian official to visit the US after Donald Trump's election victory.

This upcoming visit is pivotal in strengthening Indo-US relations amid the ongoing political transitions in the United States.

item.title: Joe Biden commutes death sentences of 37 including child killers, mass murderers: Full list - The Times of India
item.description:
Biden Commutes Death Sentences for 37 Individuals, Including Murderers

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Times of India

President Joe Biden has commuted the death sentences of 37 individuals, including five child killers and several mass murderers. Biden emphasized that his decision is based on a belief that the death penalty should be abolished at a federal level.

  • 37 out of 40 men had their sentences commuted.
  • Among those pardoned are numerous convicted for serious crimes, including child murder.
  • Biden still condemns the crimes committed by the individuals but believes halting the death penalty is necessary.
  • Three notable individuals—Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, Robert Bowers, and Dylann Roof—did not receive commutations.
“Make no mistake: I condemn these murderers, grieve for the victims of their despicable acts, and ache for all the families who have suffered unimaginable and irreparable loss,” Biden stated.

The commutations come as part of a broader trend in Biden's administration towards criminal justice reform and are significant in the dialogue surrounding the death penalty in the United States.

item.title: Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named. Not Axar Patel Or Y.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ravichandran Ashwin's Replacement In India's Border Gavaskar Trophy Squad Named

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team has selected young Mumbai off-spinner Tanush Kotian to replace Ravichandran Ashwin, who announced his retirement following the third Test in Brisbane.

  • Tanush Kotian has played 33 First Class matches, taking 101 wickets.
  • Kotian has been included as a precautionary measure and will travel to Australia.
  • Originally, Axar Patel was considered for the replacement but opted out due to personal reasons.
  • Ashwin retired as India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket.
"I made myself a promise in 2012, we lost a tricky series against England. I was very early in my career and I was just telling myself we are not gonna lose another one. Ever. And that is what I promised myself," said Ashwin.

The addition of Kotian underscores the Indian team's strategy to maintain squad strength following Ashwin's retirement.

item.title: Pushpa 2 Hindi Worldwide Box Office (18 Days): Beats Salman Khan’s No.1 Grosser & Ranbir Kapoor’s Animal, Needs 67.85 Crores To Create History! - Koimoi
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Hindi Worldwide Box Office (18 Days): Beats Salman Khan’s No.1 Grosser & Ranbir Kapoor’s

Publication Date: Recently

Source: Koimoi

Pushpa 2 has taken the box office by storm, emerging as the fourth highest-grossing Hindi film ever, surpassing major hits like Bajrangi Bhaijaan and Animal in just 18 days.

  • The film has grossed 932.15 crore worldwide.
  • It earned 692.50 crore net in India.
  • It is expected to join the 1000 crore club soon.
“Whenever it happens, the Allu Arjun starrer will become the first Hindi-dubbed film from the South to score 1000 crores globally.”

This monumental success highlights the film's widespread appeal and strong performance in the Hindi market.

item.title: BRS vs Congress intensifies after vandalisation at Allu Arjun's house; all 6 accused get bail - The Times of India
item.description:
BRS vs Congress intensifies after vandalisation at Allu Arjun's house; all 6 accused get bail

Date: Publication date not specified Source: Times of India

The article covers the intensifying political conflict between BRS and Congress following vandalism at Telugu actor Allu Arjun's house, where protesters demanded compensation after a stampede linked to the actor's film.

  • Vandalism occurred at Allu Arjun’s residence by a group claiming ties to Osmania University Joint Action Committee.
  • Protesters seek Rs 1 crore for the family of a woman who died during a stampede at a film screening.
  • Six individuals were arrested for the vandalism and granted bail.
  • BJP and BRS criticize Congress over governance and law and order issues.
  • Chief minister condemns the incident and calls for strict law enforcement.
“Attacks on film personalities or anyone are unacceptable.” - Chief Minister Revanth Reddy

This incident reflects growing tensions in the political landscape and the film industry in Telangana, with significant public and political discourse likely to follow.

item.title: Massive ocean found in deep space - Telangana Today
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: South Korea says it detects signs of North Korea preparing more troops, drones for Russia - Reuters
item.description:
South Korea Detects North Korea Preparing Troops and Drones for Russia

Date: December 23, 2023 | Source: Reuters

South Korea's military reports detecting signs of North Korea sending more troops and weaponry to Russia to bolster its efforts in the Ukraine conflict.

  • North Korea has already delivered military equipment including multiple rocket launchers and self-propelled howitzers to Russia.
  • Preparation for suicide drone production has been noted following a recent test ordered by Kim Jong Un.
  • Estimates suggest around 12,000 North Korean troops are currently in Russia, with significant casualties reported.
  • Increased military collaboration between North Korea and Russia poses a threat to South Korea, possibly enhancing North Korea's military capabilities.
  • South Korea's leadership emphasizes the need for a strong joint security posture with the U.S. amid escalating tensions.
"With the backing of Russia, they'll likely try to stage various strategic provocations next year, such as launching intercontinental ballistic missiles and conducting a nuclear test..." - JCS Official

This development highlights the deteriorating security situation and the potential for further escalations in the region, prompting vigilance from South Korea and its allies.

item.title: Centre scraps no-detention policy for classes 5 and 8 students who fail to clear year-end exams - Greater Kashmir
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: AIIMS, Delhi developing low cost adaptive cellular therapy for treatment of multiple myeloma - The Hindu
item.description:
AIIMS, Delhi developing low cost adaptive cellular therapy for treatment of multiple myeloma

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Doctors at AIIMS, Delhi are developing a low-cost antibody-based therapy for multiple myeloma, a type of blood cancer. This innovative approach aims to make advanced CAR-T cell therapies more accessible and affordable in India.

  • The therapy targets B-cell maturation antigen (BCMA) to specifically eliminate multiple myeloma cells.
  • Animal trials have shown promising results, with plans for phase-1 human clinical trials on the horizon.
  • The goal is to significantly reduce the costs associated with existing CAR-T cell therapies.
“CAR-T cell therapies have changed the way we approach and treat cancer. Development of CAR-T cell therapy has been in a nascent state in India despite the rapid pace at which it is moving around the world.” - Dr. Mayank Singh

This development is significant as it seeks to provide a more viable treatment option for many patients in India, addressing both cost and accessibility challenges.

item.title: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe to make history with unprecedented flyby of the Sun’s corona on Christmas eve D - The Times of India
item.description:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe to Make Historic Flyby of the Sun’s Corona on Christmas Eve

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Times of India

The Parker Solar Probe is set to achieve a historic milestone by flying through the Sun's corona on December 24, 2024, at a record distance of 3.8 million miles from the Sun’s surface. This flyby marks the 22nd close approach of the spacecraft, launched in 2018, aimed at studying the Sun's inner workings and the mysterious discrepancy in temperatures between its surface and corona.

  • The Parker Solar Probe will measure magnetic fields and charged particles in the Sun's outer atmosphere.
  • It travels at speeds of 430,000 miles per hour, making it the fastest man-made object.
  • The probe is equipped with a specialized heat shield capable of withstanding temperatures as high as 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.
  • The closest approach will occur at 6:53 a.m. EST on December 24.
  • Data collected will provide insights into solar flares, coronal mass ejections, and their impact on space weather.
“This historic flyby will help reveal the secrets of the Sun, allowing us to protect our technology from solar disruptions.”

The Parker Solar Probe's upcoming flyby on December 24 is expected to yield groundbreaking data about solar phenomena that could protect Earth’s technologies from solar-induced disruptions.

item.title: Vinod Kambli's Health Deteriorates, Admitted To Hospital. Report Says Condition Stable But... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's Health Deteriorates, Admitted To Hospital

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: IANS

Former Indian cricket star Vinod Kambli has been hospitalized due to a serious health issue. Though his condition is reported to be stable, it remains critical. Kambli's recent public appearances have sparked concerns over his health.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akriti Hospital in Thane after his health deteriorated.
  • His condition is stable but remains critical according to reports.
  • He communicated with fans via social media, giving a thumbs-up to show he is improving.
  • Kambli revealed he has been battling a urine infection and has received support from his family and friends.
  • He expressed gratitude towards his wife and children for their support during his recovery.
"I am better now. My wife takes care of me a lot. She took me to 3 different hospitals and told me 'You have to get fit'." - Vinod Kambli

Kambli's struggles highlight the importance of health and family support in recovery. Fans and former teammates are rallying behind him during this challenging time.

item.title: Sheikh Hasina extradition: Bangladesh sends note verbale asking India to send back deposed PM - The Hindu
item.description:
Bangladesh Requests Extradition of Deposed PM Sheikh Hasina from India

Published: December 23, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Bangladesh's interim government has requested the extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina from India, where she has been living in exile since fleeing the country amid protests.

  • Sheikh Hasina fled to India on August 5, 2024, amid student-led protests that deposed her.
  • Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal has issued arrest warrants against Hasina for crimes against humanity.
  • The interim government has sent a diplomatic note to India requesting her return for judicial proceedings.
  • An existing extradition treaty between Bangladesh and India could facilitate the process.
“Bangladesh wants her back here for the judicial process,” Foreign Affairs Adviser Touhid Hossain said.

In conclusion, Bangladesh is actively pursuing the legal return of Sheikh Hasina to face serious charges stemming from her time in office.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 And Reno 13 Pro India Launch In January 2025: All You Need To Know - Times Now
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 and Reno 13 Pro Set to Launch in India in January 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times Now

The Oppo Reno 13 series is confirmed to launch in India by the end of January 2025, featuring significant upgrades in design and camera setup.

  • The Reno 13 Pro will be available in Graphite Grey and Mist Lavender.
  • The Reno 13 will come in Ivory White and Luminous Blue.
  • Both models will feature a triple camera setup and an OLED display.
  • The Reno 13 Pro has a thickness of 7.55mm and weighs 195g, while the Reno 13 ranges between 7.24 to 7.29mm and weighs 181g.
  • Both phones are expected to be 5G capable and include premium features like IP66, IP68, and IP69 ratings.
  • The Reno 13 Pro will likely come with a MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset, according to leaks.
“The Reno 13 series will sport a triple camera setup and a flat display.”

In conclusion, the Oppo Reno 13 series promises to bring advanced features and elegant designs to the smartphone market in early 2025.

item.title: Bangladesh sends India formal note seeking extradition of Sheikh Hasina - The Times of India
item.description:
Bangladesh Requests Extradition of Sheikh Hasina from India

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Bangladesh has formally approached India seeking the extradition of Sheikh Hasina, the current Prime Minister of Bangladesh, amidst ongoing political tensions.

  • The extradition request is based on numerous allegations against Sheikh Hasina.
  • This move is expected to raise diplomatic tensions between the two countries.
  • Officials from both nations are likely to engage in discussions regarding the legitimacy of the request.
“This could have significant implications for regional security and diplomacy.”

This development highlights the complex political relationship between Bangladesh and India and will require careful diplomatic handling.

item.title: Constipation Awareness Month 2024: 10 Dietary Changes You Can Make For Better Digestion - Zee News
item.description:
Constipation Awareness Month 2024: 10 Dietary Changes You Can Make For Better Digestion

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Zee News

December is Constipation Awareness Month, focusing on improving digestion and combatting constipation through dietary changes. Here are 10 recommendations for better digestive health:

  • Increase fibre intake by consuming whole grains, fruits, and vegetables.
  • Stay hydrated with water and herbal teas.
  • Incorporate probiotics found in yogurt and kefir.
  • Avoid processed foods high in unhealthy fats and sugars.
  • Include healthy fats such as olive oil and avocados.
  • Add magnesium-rich foods like spinach and nuts.
  • Eat smaller, more frequent meals instead of large portions.
  • Avoid caffeine and alcohol to prevent dehydration.
  • Don’t skip meals to maintain regular eating patterns.
  • Experiment with natural laxatives like prunes and papaya.
“By making these simple dietary changes, you can improve your digestion, reduce constipation, and enhance your overall health.”

Awareness campaigns during Constipation Awareness Month encourage healthier habits and prompt individuals to seek medical help when necessary.

item.title: Vinod Kambli admitted to Thane hospital in critical condition - The Times of India
item.description:
Vinod Kambli in Critical Condition, Hospitalized in Thane

Publication Date: Saturday Night
Source: IANS

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli has been hospitalized in Thane, Maharashtra, due to health issues. His recent public appearances, including an event at Shivaji Park, contrasted with his current critical health condition.

  • Kambli's condition is described as stable but critical.
  • He has faced health challenges recently, including a serious urine problem.
  • Support has poured in from his teammates, including Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar.
  • Kambli had undergone two heart surgeries previously in 2013.
  • His international cricket career included noteworthy achievements, including being the first Indian with consecutive double centuries in Tests.
“I was suffering from a urine problem. It was just flowing. My son, Jesus Cristiano, picked me up and brought me back to my feet.”

The cricket community is rallying around Kambli as he seeks recovery from his recent health setbacks.

item.title: Galaxy Unpacked 2025: Samsung may introduce 'Slim' model in S25 series - Business Standard
item.description:
Galaxy Unpacked 2025: Samsung may introduce 'Slim' model in S25 series

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: 91mobiles

Samsung is set to unveil the Galaxy S25 series in January 2025, with potential plans for a new 'Slim' model coming later in the second quarter.

  • The Galaxy S25 Slim is expected to be only 6mm thick, compared to 7.6mm for the Galaxy S24.
  • The smartphone may offer a 6.66-inch display and a 4,700mAh battery.
  • It is likely to include a triple-camera system: a 200MP main sensor, a 50MP telephoto lens, and a 50MP ultra-wide lens.
  • The device may feature a Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite processor.
  • It aims to compete directly with Apple's iPhone 17 Air.
“Samsung’s Galaxy S25 Slim could be a direct competitor to Apple’s thin-profile iPhone 17 Air.”

In summary, the Galaxy S25 Slim emphasizes a sleek design and competitive specifications, setting the stage for an interesting market battle with Apple's upcoming offerings.

item.title: WhatsApp to stop working on older phones, including some samsung Galaxy models, after December 31 - India TV News
item.description:
WhatsApp to Stop Working on Older Phones After December 31

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: India TV News

WhatsApp, with over two billion users, will discontinue support for several older smartphone models from January 1, 2025, impacting users primarily on older versions of Android.

  • More than 20 smartphones will lose access, primarily those running Android KitKat and earlier.
  • Brands affected include Samsung, LG, Motorola, HTC, and Sony.
  • Users will not receive updates, bug fixes, or security patches on these devices.
  • The change also affects other Meta platforms such as Facebook and Instagram.
“Older operating systems lack the necessary capabilities for advanced features and can present security vulnerabilities.”

Though WhatsApp will continue to function on these phones, the lack of support for updates raises security concerns for users with outdated devices.

item.title: Adani Group expands aviation reach with ₹400 crore acquisition of Air Works group - The Economic Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Ousted Syrian President Assad’s Wife Unhappy With Life In Russia? What Led Her To File For Divorce - News18
item.description:
Asma al-Assad Files for Divorce Amid Dissatisfaction in Moscow

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: News18

The British wife of ousted Syrian president Bashar al-Assad, Asma, has filed for divorce, expressing her unhappiness with life in Moscow where her family has sought asylum.

  • Asma al-Assad filed for divorce in a Russian court after dissatisfaction with her life in Moscow.
  • She reportedly wishes to return to her hometown in London.
  • Asma moved to Syria in 2000 after marrying Bashar al-Assad.
  • Reports indicate that her divorce application is currently being evaluated by Russian authorities.
  • Bashar al-Assad was granted asylum in Moscow after being ousted by rebels.
  • He is living under restrictions and cannot leave Moscow or engage in political activities.
Russian authorities have frozen Bashar al-Assad’s assets, including gold and real estate.

The situation reflects the complexities faced by the Assad family after the fall of their regime, with Asma seeking a return to a more familiar life in the UK.

item.title: OPPO Reno 13 series will launch in India in January; design and colours confirmed - 91mobiles
item.description:
OPPO Reno 13 series India launch month, design, colours confirmed

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: 91mobiles

OPPO is preparing for the global launch of the Reno 13 series in January 2025, including in India. The Reno 13 and Reno 13 Pro will feature distinct design elements and a variety of color options.

  • Launch scheduled for January 2025.
  • Reno 13 Pro will come in Graphite Grey and Mist Lavender, while Reno 13 will be available in Ivory White and Luminous Blue.
  • Graphite Grey and Luminous Blue have a matte finish; Ivory White and Mist Lavender have a glossy look.
  • Innovative design with grayscale exposure laser direct writing technique for the glossy finishes.
  • Luminous Blue variant features a glowing camera module.
  • Constructed with an aerospace-grade aluminium frame and a Gorilla Glass 7i front.
  • Reno 13 Pro has 93.8% screen-to-body ratio; Reno 13 has 93.4%.
  • Both models offer IP66, IP68, and IP69 water and dust resistance ratings.

Performance: The Reno 13 Pro recently scored 1301 in single-core and 3930 in multi-core on Geekbench, featuring Android 15 and MediaTek Dimensity 8350 processor.

item.title: Russia reacts to reports of ousted Syrian President Assad’s wife seeking divorce - The Times of India
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Protests in J&K over reservation policy, CM Omar Abdullah's son joins stir | What we know - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Protests in J&K Over Reservation Policy, CM Omar Abdullah's Son Joins Stir

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Hindustan Times

Several political leaders and hundreds of students have gathered outside the residence of Jammu and Kashmir chief minister Omar Abdullah to seek a review of the reservation policy, introduced by the administration earlier this year.

  • Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's son joined the protests alongside students and party members.
  • Opposition leaders have also expressed their dissent regarding the new reservation policy.
  • The Jammu and Kashmir government formed a panel to review the policy amid growing calls for its revision.
“We hope the govt that came to power with a huge mandate and with a promise that they will rationalise the reservation - we hope the NC govt fulfils their promises in a time-bound manner.” - Iltija Mufti

The growing unrest over the reservation policy highlights significant political and social tensions within Jammu and Kashmir, particularly concerning youth representation and equitable access to opportunities.

item.title: A look at Team India's probable Schedule of ICC Champions Trophy 2025 - India.com
item.description:
Team India's Schedule for ICC Champions Trophy 2025

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: India.com

The ICC Champions Trophy 2025 is approaching with a new hybrid model, ensuring India's matches are hosted in the UAE amidst security concerns over travel to Pakistan.

  • India will play group stage matches in Dubai against Bangladesh on February 20 and New Zealand on March 2.
  • Pakistan will begin the tournament with their first match against New Zealand in Karachi on February 19.
  • The semifinal matches are scheduled for March 4 and 5, with the final set for March 9.
  • Neutral venues will be used for matches between India and Pakistan to maintain impartiality.
  • Hosting all of India's matches in UAE aims to ensure a secure environment.
"Given the ongoing political tensions between India and Pakistan, any matches between these two nations will be played at impartial venues."

This tournament promises to be an exciting event, with critical matches taking place in Dubai offering neutral grounds for competing teams.

item.title: Jayant removes all RLD spokespersons after Dalit leader slams Amit Shah for Ambedkar remarks - ThePrint
item.description:
Jayant removes all RLD spokespersons after Dalit leader slams Amit Shah for Ambedkar remarks

Date: Recent
Source: ThePrint

In a swift decision, Jayant Chaudhary, leader of the Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD), has removed all national and state spokespersons following remarks made by Dalit leader Kamal Gautam, who criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments about Ambedkar.

  • All RLD national and state spokespersons were dismissed for being either inactive or overly active.
  • The decision followed Gautam's call for Shah to apologize for his 'inappropriate' remarks on Ambedkar.
  • Shah asserted his statements were misrepresented and defended his remarks in the Rajya Sabha.
  • Gautam highlighted the lack of action against rising criminal incidents affecting Dalits and women.
  • The removal may indicate internal party tensions regarding public comments and coalition dynamics.
“Amit Shah’s statement on Babasaheb is not correct... This will reach all those who follow Babasaheb across the world.” - Kamal Gautam

This incident underscores the sensitivity surrounding Dalit issues within Indian politics and the reaction of political parties to internal dissent.

item.title: Congress denies link to vandalism at Pushpa 2 actor Allu Arjun's residence in Hyderabad: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Denies Any Link to Vandalism at Allu Arjun's Residence

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Congress party has denied allegations of involvement in the vandalism at actor Allu Arjun's residence in Hyderabad, following a stampede incident during the premiere of his film, Pushpa 2.

  • The vandalism occurred amid protests outside Allu Arjun's house in response to the Sandhya Theatre stampede incident that resulted in a woman’s death.
  • Congress spokesperson Sama Ram Mohan Reddy clarified that none of the accused are affiliated with the party.
  • Telangana CM Revanth Reddy condemned the attack and called for strict action from law enforcement.
  • Protesters identified as students from Osmania University allegedly caused damage to Allu Arjun's property.
“I condemn the attack on the homes of film celebrities. I am directing the State DGP and City Police Commissioner to take strict action regarding law and order.” - Revanth Reddy

The incident highlights ongoing tensions and the dissatisfaction among certain groups following the tragic events at the theatre.
